title: How to Make Popping Hawaiian Punch

steps.headline: Take out the large glass bowl.
steps.description: Pour in frozen orange juice concentrate, lemonade and Hawaiian punch.

steps.headline: Scoop in raspberry sherbet, and stir with a wooden spoon.
Pour ginger ale gently around sides of bowl.
Pour the mixture in the bowl into 20 glasses.
steps.description: Put the glasses in the refrigerator for now.

steps.headline: Take out your favorite fruit juice and extra orange juice.
steps.description: Pour in the ice trays the juice, half orange, half the other juice. Put the ice tray in the freezer.

steps.headline: Take out the glasses.
steps.description: Line each rim carefully with cherry syrup, and before it gets sticky, pour on the pop rocks in the rim. Don't mind if a few get in the punch.

steps.headline: Take out the straws.
steps.description: Put the nozzle from the cherry syrup container into a straw, and give a squeeze, and funnel in some pop rocks. Place straw into glass. Do the same for all straws. Put the glasses back in the refrigerator.

steps.headline: Take out the pretzels and fruit roll ups.
steps.description: Cut the fruit roll ups into circles, and do the same for the 20 fruit roll ups.

steps.headline: Using the knife, put a little hole into the center of each fruit roll up.
Stick the fruit roll ups into the pretzels, and put a dab of cherry syrup so it stays.
Take out the glasses and ice cubes.
steps.description: Put some ice cubes in each cup, and put a lemon edge on the rims. On the edge of the cup, stick in the umbrellas and put in a little cherry syrup so it stays.

steps.headline: Put in the refrigerator until its time to serve.

text: Take out the large glass bowl. Pour in frozen orange juice concentrate, lemonade and Hawaiian punch. Scoop in raspberry sherbet, and stir with a wooden spoon.  Pour ginger ale gently around sides of bowl.  Pour the mixture in the bowl into 20 glasses. Put the glasses in the refrigerator for now. Take out your favorite fruit juice and extra orange juice. Pour in the ice trays the juice, half orange, half the other juice. Put the ice tray in the freezer. Take out the glasses. Line each rim carefully with cherry syrup, and before it gets sticky, pour on the pop rocks in the rim. Don't mind if a few get in the punch. Take out the straws. Put the nozzle from the cherry syrup container into a straw, and give a squeeze, and funnel in some pop rocks. Place straw into glass. Do the same for all straws. Put the glasses back in the refrigerator. Take out the five lemons. Cut each lemon into 4 wedges. Take out the pretzels and fruit roll ups. Cut the fruit roll ups into circles, and do the same for the 20 fruit roll ups. Using the knife, put a little hole into the center of each fruit roll up.  Stick the fruit roll ups into the pretzels, and put a dab of cherry syrup so it stays.  Take out the glasses and ice cubes. Put some ice cubes in each cup, and put a lemon edge on the rims. On the edge of the cup, stick in the umbrellas and put in a little cherry syrup so it stays. Put in the refrigerator until its time to serve.
